Details: Both agents produced comprehensive SQL Server documentation for customer order analysis queries. Agent1_SQLServer_Doc provided a structured 10-section format covering overview, code structure, data flow, performance optimization, and complexity analysis. Agent2_SQL_TO_DBT delivered similar content with slight variations in formatting and some additional technical details like API costs. Both documents address the same business problem of customer order analytics and follow enterprise data warehousing best practices.

Both outputs address identical business objectives: generating customer order summaries from raw transactional data. They describe the same SQL components (CTEs, joins, aggregations), same tables (raw.orders, raw.users, raw.order_items, raw.products), and same business benefits (customer segmentation, targeted marketing). Minor differences in emphasis on specific technical details like API costs (Agent2_SQL_TO_DBT lines 480-485) and complexity scoring methodology.

Both documents follow similar 10-section structures: Overview, Code Structure, Data Flow, Data Mapping, Performance Optimization, Technical Elements, Complexity Analysis, Assumptions, Key Outputs, and Error Handling. Agent1_SQLServer_Doc uses more bullet points and structured formatting, while Agent2_SQL_TO_DBT uses more narrative descriptions. Both maintain logical flow from high-level overview to technical implementation details.

Documentation is syntactically correct with proper section numbering, consistent terminology, and accurate technical references. Minor formatting inconsistencies in bullet point alignment (lines 45-50) and one instance of incomplete sentence structure in performance section (line 180).
